# Module 3: Working with Files

## Introduction
- Explanation of how Python can be used to work with different types of files, such as CSV, Excel, and PDF
- Overview of how file manipulation is relevant to data analysis, report generation, and compliance in the banking industry
- Explanation of how to use Python to read, write, and manipulate files efficiently

## Relevance
- Explanation of how working with files is a crucial part of many banking tasks, such as data processing, report generation, and compliance reporting
- Overview of how Python can be used to automate common file manipulation tasks, such as file conversion and merging

## Topics covered
- Working with different file formats (CSV, Excel, PDF)
- Reading and writing files using Python
- File conversion and merging
- Working with compressed files (zip, gzip)

## Practical example
- Example code for reading and cleaning data from a CSV file using Python
- Demonstration of how to manipulate Excel files using Python and the xlwings library
- Example code for converting and merging multiple CSV files using Python
- Overview of how to work with compressed files using Python

Overall, this module will provide learners with practical skills for working with different types of files using Python, with a specific focus on their applications in the banking industry. Learners will come away from this module with an understanding of how to read, write, and manipulate files efficiently, as well as how to automate common file manipulation tasks.
